concept.title: Cleaning Materials for Typewriters
concept.shortdesc: Various cleaning materials are used to maintain and restore typewriters, each suited for specific cleaning tasks. it is essential to know which one is right for your typeweiter model.

section.title: Recommended Cleaning Materials
section.p: Safe cleaning materials remove dust, ink, and residue without corroding metal or degrading rubber and paint surfaces. Commonly recommended materials include:

ul.li: Mild soap and water or diluted all-purpose cleaners
Mineral spirits, gentle degreasers, or rubbing alcohol for removing oil and grime
Compressed air with thin nozzle attachments for dislodging debris from tight spaces
Soft-bristle brushes, such as car detailing brushes or toothbrushes
Lint-free cloths, microfiber towels, and cotton swabs for surface cleaning
Light-weight oils such as sewing machine oil or typewriter-specific lubricants

section.title: Materials to Avoid
section.p: Certain substances can damage internal mechanisms, paint, or rubber components. Avoid the following materials when cleaning a typewriter:

ul.li: Acetone, nail polish remover, or other strong solvents that can dissolve paint and plastics
Bleach, ammonia, or other corrosive household cleaners
Abrasive pads, steel wool, or coarse sandpaper that can scratch metal surfaces
WD-40 or similar penetrating oils that leave residue and attract dust
High-pressure air compressors without a regulator, which can dislodge delicate parts

section.note: Refer to the Typewriter Maintenance Materials topic for more details on cleaning materias.
